text:
NOSE: Lychee! Dark smooth roast coffee comes afterward~ very very lovely smell!

TASTE: CItrus roasted coffee? Some dark chocolate, maybe a hint of grapefruit? And quite malty, thick mouth-feel!

AFTERTASTE: Long, with some dark chocolate bitterness. A solid 4!
Pitch black, beige head, very fine bubbles. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, fruity, spices. Very bitter, starts out wet but gets dry in the aftertaste. Creamy mouthfeel.
Bottle.Black colour with medium beige head.Aroma is roasted and fruity with taste of blackberries and greapfruits,nice malty with chocolate flavors aswell,oily texture and smooth mild spicey finish.

Draught sample at Delirium Hoppy Loft, Brussels. Opaque brown with brownish head. The aroma has lots of roastiness, coffee, "green" citrus and butter. Bitter flavor with some roastiness, coffee and citrus, "green". Medium-bodied.
Draft sample at Delirium Hoppy Loft. Thanks 77ships! Brown black color. Aroma of roasted malt and fruity hops. Sweetish, coffee, a bit green, fruity, bitter finish. Light-bodied, easy drinking. Nice.

330 ml Bottle from St Albans Beer Shop, St Albans, UK. Colour is dark brown with a big, frothy, creamy, long lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet malty, chocolate, dark fruits, berries, coffee, herbs. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is average. Finish is long, malty with nice bitterness. Overall very nice black IPA.

Bottle from Hippo Beers, Glasgow. Beer served in 8°C, Duvel Glass. Pours black, with really nice head. Aroma is very subtle, ashy, earthy, some dust, and then blackberry comes in when its getting warmer, and oxidized hops, probably beer spent too long in the shop because hoppy aroma is completely gone. Flavor is rich, probably also thanks to the full, oily and sticky body, blackcurrant, blackberry, intense liquorice, herbal and spicy hops bitterness. Good beer, I wish to drink it fresher some day.

Bottle at The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a deep brown to black colour with a medium tan head. Aroma of blackberry, blackcurrant, grapefruit, a little pine, a hint of green pepper, maybe mint, slight chocolate and some spicy hops. Taste of blackberry, some green pepper, a little grapefruit, dark chocolate, a hint of liquorice and spicy, herbal hops. Medium bodied and soft carbonation. A dryish, chocolatey, spicy, herbal hop bitterness in the finish. OMG! What a black IPA, very hop forward but not citrusy like most beers in this style. Herbal, spicy and fruity and oh so smooth. Superb.
Bottle from appellation wines dalry road. Pours hazy dark brown. Nose of tangy green hops, roasted malts, tropical fruit, dark chocolate, cherries. Taste is more fruit, earthy, bitter chocolate.
Bottle. Black, medium tam head. Hops, coffee, grapefruit. Bitter taste with tart finish.

Nera con splendido cappello di schiuma marroncina compatta e persistente. Al naso note erbacee intende con tostatura. Al palato è veramente eccellente, con un equilibrio notevole tra malto tostato e luppolatura. Lamaro è persistente, il corpo leggero. Buona.
On the nose are fruity hops, and some metallic porter notes. The flavour starts of with dark fruits , but finishes in a viscous bitter bite. Superb beer.

Aromat: średnio intensywny, słodkie świeże owoce i owoce suszone
Wygląd: bardzo ciemne, piękna warstwa jasnobeżowej, drobnopęcherzykowej piany na półtora centymetra, chwilkę utrzymującej się i oblepiającej ścianki szkła.
Smak: zdecydowanie intensywniejszy niż aromat. Kawa i paloność, chmielowa żywiczna goryczka podbijana palonością. Trochę gorzko czekoladowej słodyczy. Bardzo przyjemne i bogate w smaku i pijalne. Dosyć wytrawne i dobrze, że nie ma niepotrzebnej słodyczy. Tempest trzyma wysoki poziom, bardzo smaczne piwo
Noire, mousse épaisse blanc cassé; épices, amertume, léger fumé, café, chocolat. Bonne bière, bien faite.

Bottle from Boxbeers. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt and moderate hoppy - fruity and citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 260317
Bottle. Pours black with an off white. Aroma of stale dusty hops, slight licorice, light toffee. Taste is rather bitter, loads of caramel, dusty, heavy licorice, sligt ash, quite roasty.

33cl bottle from boxbeers.dk. Pours pitch black with a thick light-brown head. Aroma is lots of chocolate, roasty malt, hops,and hints of coffee. Creamy, smooth mouthfeel, balanced. Flavor is chocolate, roasty, citrus and hints of coffee and licorice. Long finish. very nice!
Poured from bottle, little head, floaties,hoppy and coffy, good taste, right carbonation

Black colour, mediumsized beigeish brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, some dried fruits, raisins, alcohol and mild wooden notes. Flavour is roasted, ashy and some dried dark fruits.

Poured from a 330ml bottle @home. Very dark brown. Very hazy to opaque. Large scattered sediment. Frothy, bone-brown head with good lacing, slightly lasting. Hoppy bouquet of pine and citrus. Lightly roasted malt/toast aroma. Clean and crisp medium-strong bitterness. Lightly sweet. Medium bodied. Medium to medium strong carbonation.
Bottle @ home. Black colour with a nice head. Smells and tastes roasty, fresh, fruity, grapefruit, hops. Pretty good black ipa in my book. Nice body, fitting carbo.
Bottle (Public Corner). Opaque black color, small beige head. Burnt tyre, roasted, licorice, hops. Medium-bodied. Licorice, dark malts, some hops, ashy and alcohol. Imperial stoutish. Ok.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */Haras, Tampere, Finland. Medium, soft aroma with dark fruits, some licorice and a hint of roasted malts and lactose. Pitch black color with minimal natural white head. Medium, smooth and balanced taste with dark fruits, some dark chocolate, hops and some bit roasted malts. Medium taste spectrum and long aftertaste with hoppy dark fruits. Medium body with medium/light carbonation. Overall, smooth and high quality, though hit simple.
Butelka w Carpe Kraft. Niezłe Black IPA, aromacie bardziej przypominał normalne IPA. Dobrze pijalne, goryczka mogłaby być nieco wyższa.
Hoppy but also roasted, malty, very dark with a thin head, light/medium body, medium carbonation, malty and hoppy, roasted and some coffee...maybe also hoppy porter.

Bottle ordered online. Black and impenetrable. A bit of tan head, and lacing on the glass. Amazingly intense pine aroma. Some sweet liquorice, a touch of spearmint. Bitter taste with liquorice, mint and coffee grounds. Long bitter finish. Its really good, and I dig the flavours. It lacks the complexity of the very best BIPAs but its a pleasure to drink.

Butelka 330ml.Kolor czarny, nieprzejrzysty, piana beżowa oblepiająca szkło. Aromat orzechowy z alkoholem w tle, w smaku też wysoka paloność z alkoholem, goryczka średnia ledwo wyczuwalna przykryta przez nuty paloności. Bardzo dobre piwo.

Robe café serré, mousse café au lait moyenne, retombant en fin filet. Nez café michoco : caramel et chocolat, le houblon se distingue au bout du nez : résine et herbe fraiche. En bouche, on est plus proche dune IPA : agrume et résine, la fin de bouche est plus sur le malt grillé et le café. Belle amertume, corps épais, superbe longueur, bonne carbo, légère astringence. Le style est assez difficile à décrire, comme dans lannonce entre lIPA et la porter, très bonne bière, originale et savoureuse.

On tap at Vultures Lane. Pours almost pitch black. Coffee, blackberry, aniseed, plum, fig, pine, grapefruit. Finishes a little smokey. Huge flavour, and yet so complex that every sip brings something new. Absolutely incredible.

Restrained aroma in an inky black pour. A tasty beer but people need to get a grip. A double BLACK IPA has to be an oxymoron - surely? Californians may be able to get away with it - but the Scots? Surely not...

Really good version of the style. Slight beige head and on top of a very dark body. I get porter first, with caramel roasted malt and a dusting of chocolate. Then the fruit comes through and its lovely, with blackberry, orange, maybe grapefruit. Body is medium to full and creamy.

13/20 tastes like an IPA to me, not getting much of the soft fruits or chocolate. Fresh tasting IPA, easy to drink

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle from Pulapka, Gdansk
Aroma of pine and forest, resin, some citrus. 
Taste is medium bitter with lots of pine, some cocoa and roastiness.
Medium low body, medium carbonation

Bottle. It pours jet black with a creamy beige head. Spice, licorice, pine, fresh fruit and light roast in the aroma. The flavor is pine, tropical fruit, licorice, spice and roasted malt. Creamy texture. Fruity hoppy finish. Great stuff!

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, orange, pine, chocolate, roasted malts, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with slight yeast and with a slight/medium brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, orange, pine and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts, hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Gets a lot of its sweet flavours from the dry hopping and has a little bit of chocolate. The finish is mostly roasted malts with a tiny bit of bitter hops. Amazing Black IPA overall.

33cl bottle @home. 
The beer poured pitch black with a thick light brown head. 
Chocolate, roasted malt, ash, hops, coffee notes in aroma. Creamy, smooth mouthfeel, balanced and still quite aggressively hopped. 
Chocolate in flavor, mild ash, roast and some licorice along with citrus fruity hoppyness. Long hoppy finish, nice balance. One of the best black IPAs I have had. Solid!

Keg Third of a Pint at BrewDog, Camden, London in Jan 2016 - Dark Brown / Near Black in colour. Good creamy tan head. Excellent lacing. Very Malty; roasty malts, dark chocolate, coffee. Fruity; orange and grapefruit citrus. Hoppy; piney resinous hops. Good malt/fruit/hop balance. Bitter-sweet roast chocolate and coffee malty and citrus fruity piney hoppy throughout. Very Drinkable. Enjoyed this. Lovely well balanced BIPA! (2016-01-27)

Bottle. Pours black with small tan head. Aroma: roasty, citrus, pine needles, sunflower, light chocolate notes. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter, chocolate, citrus, pine, resin, some coffee. Roasted, a little too burnt finish. Medium body and carbonation. Very good, rich and complex.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BB 29 Aug 2017, at Bar Molotow, 20170111) The beer poured black. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had pine, liquorice, caramel and burnt malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were pine, sweetness, liquorice, burnt malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet and, hoppy and bitter. A pleasant hoppy burnt brew.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 Bottle 33 cl. Glass : tulip. This black is really black with beige head. Arômes : pin/résine, chocolat, épices, herbes, café, raisin etc. Bouche : fraîche, ronde et déjà amère ; saveurs de chocolat, épices, malt grillé ... et en retro coffee with amertume +++ Beautyful BIPA, un de mes styles préférés. One of my favorite styles.

From 330ml bottle. Pours black with some off white head. Very appealing fruity aroma of pineapple. Taste is surprisingly light and fruity with hints of citrus and tropical fruit. Slight roasted malt bitterness in the aftertaste. Very good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. A black beer with a huge dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, bread, citrus fruits, and hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of citrus fruits, hops, roasted malt, chocolate, and bread, leading to a bitter finish.
Bottled. Pours black with an average beige head. Aroma of slightly roasted malt, chocolate, grapefruit and pine. Sweet flavor that ends up being dry and bitter. A very nice BIPA. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

W nosie średnio/wyraźnie intensywnie słodkie cytrusy, ananas, czekolada, trochę żywicy w tle, aromaty bardzo fajnie skomponowane. Barwa czarna, piwo nieprzejrzyste, piana niska, beżowa i gęsta o drobnych ziarnach. W smaku już więcej "ciemnego piwa", czekolada, kawa, jakieś ciemne owoce leśne, trochę paloności i żywicy, finisz kwaskowo-wytrawny. Goryczka średnia w kierunku niskiej, palona. Kolejne piwo z Tempest i nie zawodzi, naprawdę dobra rzecz. Butelka do 30.05.2017
Black beer, beige head. Malty citrus aroma. Flavour is a typical black IPA mix. Citrus, hop, tart fruit with dark earthy malt and some bitter coffee. Nice clean flavours though. Nice.

Bottle as a Christmas present thanks to s_Hartshorne, cheers Shane. Black beer with small wispy mocha head. Aroma isnt strong in the hop front, some pine and roasted malts with chocolate. Taste is burnt malts, pine resin, citrus and chocolate. Light to medium bodied with a lively carbonation. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Black, small beige froth. Aroma has pineapple and pine with daek roasted malt background. Piney bitter flavour, juicy grapefruit, coffee and chocolate. Slightly sticky, tasty and well balanced.

(330ml bottle from boxbeers.dk, bb 29/08/17) Pours black with a moderate pale tan head and spidery lace. Aroma of citrus, blueberry, blackberry, light tropical fruit, grass, light pine, underpinning of some chocolate and toasty roast. Flavour is not as fruity as the nose, semi-sweet dark caramel malts, grapefruit, berries, light chocolate and coffee, acidic roast, toast, a bit grassy and burnt in the finish as well. Moderate bitterness amplified a little by the roast. Light-medium body with average carbonation. Solid hoppy black IPA with lighter malt profile.

Bottle, 7.2%. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, pine and earthy. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, earthy, medium sweet, pine, grapefruit, little ash and medium bitter.
Rewelacja. Takie BIPA uwielbiam. Mam tu wszystko czego mi trzeba - świetny aromat i wyśmienity smak. Polecam.

Piwo bardzo dobre. Black IPA szczegolnie lubie i cenie. Barwa czarna jak nowa opona natluszczona srodkiem do konserwacji, piana szarawa, sina jakby srednia ale oblepiajaca szklo. W zapachu orzechy i bob gotowany, tak mi sie kojarzylo. Smak chmielowa gorycz subtelna palonosc, lekka nawet kawowa kwaskowosc. Troche moze zbyt alkoholowe. Ale wszystko ogolnie dobrze zgrane. Degustacyjne piwo, polecam

tap/artefakt. czarne jak węgiel z drobnopęcherzykową białą pianą, która utrzymuje się w postaci kilkumilimetrowej obrączki do końca picia. aromaty słodów palonych, czekolady, owoców tropikalnych, żywicy, po ogrzaniu niewielka ilość alkoholu. smak pełny, gładki, początkowo nieznacznie kwaskowate od paloności, później głównie gorzkie od chmielu. mega pijalne, alkohol ładnie ułożony, nasycenie w punkt

Po nalaniu tworzy się nieduża, drobna piana, która dość szybko opada do kożuszka. Barwa prawie czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Aromat dość intensywny, jest trochę żywicy, jagód, prażonego ziarna, kawy... W smaku półsłodkie, czuć iglaki, czarne owoce, kawę, czekoladę. Goryczka średnia, żywiczno palona. Wysycenie niskie do średniego, półpełne w odbiorze.

Całkiem udane BIPA, przypominające solidnie nachmielonego Stouta...
Bottle tall boys beer market. Black thin head. Roasty citrus pine aroma. Taste same good choc lots of resin nice roasty finish. Good stuff didnt blow me away
On tap. Black with small off-white head. Aroma of roasted malt and citrus. Roasted malt flavour with heavy grapefruit bitterness

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017  Rami Rami is drinking an In The Dark We Live by Tempest Brewing Co at Konstruktorska Business CenterTaka BIPA niedaleko od stouta. Zywicznie sosnowo czekoladowo. Fajne cialo. Wyrazna tez sosnowa goryczka. Pasuje mi ta interpretacja. Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2016 Bottle, 7.2% abv. Pours thin black with beige head. Aroma of blackcurrant and tropical hops. Taste is sweet, subtle roast, some coffee and distinct blackcurrant citrus hops, reminiscent of mosaic hops. Finish is a lingering bittersweet roast. Abit hot for the strength (i previously thought it was over 10% which made it taste OK), but one of better black IPAs ive had

Bottle
Aroma-citrus, fruits, pine
Appearance-black, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, lightly sour, light sweetness, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Tap at Buskers in Rome-Italy, with daniele. Black pour with caramel highlights, tick and irregular brownish foam. Nose: roast, fresh grass, nice! Mouth: far too sweet, a bit of alcohol, some oxidation but ok. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aromat pomarańczowo-żywiczny. W smaku chmielowe, przyjemnie żywiczne, goryczka ładnie zaznaczona. Lekko grzeje w przełyk. Dobre black IPA

Draft at Taps, Changkat. Black with a tan head. Aroma of citrus, pine, really fruity hops, light roast, dark chocolate and caramel. Flavour is above moderate sweet and bitter. Medium to full bodied with a nice hop resin palate and soft carbonation. Really decent.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2017 W aromacie na pierwszym planie sosna, igły, las, żywiczność, o tak, to lubię w black ipie. W wyglądzie czarne z beżową, dość gęstą pianą, ładnie zdobiącą szkło. W smaku ciemne słody z bardzo żywiczno-sosnową kontrą. Goryczka dość solidna, grejpfrutowa, chmielowa. Ponadto wyczuwalna kawa, czekolada, są też nieco w tle akcenty cytrusowe, jest w smaku dość bogato i można sporo analizować, przeważają głównie jednak akcenty leśne. Jak na gabaryty całkiem mocno pijalne, wchodzi szybko. Ogólnie bardzo przyjemna black ipa w  leśno-sosnowo-żywicznych klimatach, bardzo fajne piwo

0,33l bottle at Harrys, Jyväskylä. Pours black colour with small head. Aroma of roasted malts, tropical fruits, mango, bitterness. Taste is quite bitter, mediumish body. Fresh, very IPAish black IPA.
Čepované v Craftz House, Naprosto geniální tmavá IPA, která neměla chybu, hutná, hořká, voňavá...

Bottle 0.33l at home, Riihimäki. BB 30 May 2017. Colour is dark brown with small slightly brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, spices, chocolate, hops and malts. Pretty good but maybe too spicy for me.

330 ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Black color with nice dark beige head. Roasted malty and hoppy aroma, very balanced, chocolate, coffee, pine, grapefruit. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

330ml bottle from Saveur-Biere. Kalavklp.


Black colour with a small sticky head. Bitter, coffee, ash, refreshing stuff.

Démoni megjelenésű fekete IPA, marcona külleme nem kevésbé karakteres jegyek hordozója. Sötét tónusú komlók aromáját árasztja, szegfűszár, citrushéj, némi karamell hangulata tölti meg a teret. Ízre rendkívül teljes, a kategória mintapéldánya, meglepően telt és kerek jegyeket vonultat fel. Egyrészt friss és gyümölcsös, fekete ribizlis, lime-os, másrészt pörkölt színezetű, porteres, savanykás elemeket sorakoztat fel, mely egyveleget karakteres kesernye tereli egy irányba, a markáns mondanialót megpecsételő utóíz felé.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2016 Dark brown, clear, beige head. Aroma: citrus, pine, cocoa, caramel, hay. Light body, medium sweetness, medium to low bitterness. Citrous and coffe in flavour, finish is quite long with roasty notes.

Data ważności:  30.05.2017 
 Kolor:  Czarny, nieprzejrzysty. 
 Piana:  Beżowa, średniowysoka, drobnopęcherzykowa. Tworzy zwartą strukturę przylegających pęcherzyków. Redukuje się powoli do wąskiej otoczki. Osuwając się w dół namacalnie znaczy szkło.
Po zakręceniu kielichem maluje masę przeróżnych wzorków na szkle. 
 Zapach:  Miodzio, na prawdę miodzio! Dawno już nie piłem Black IPA. Mam wrażenie, że styl ten jest coraz mniej popularny. Niemniej jednak tego aromatu nie da się zapomnieć. Mamy tutaj ogromną porcje prażonego słonecznika, ciemnych słodów i solidną ziarnistość.
Aromat ten jest połączony z żywicznymi właściwościami chmielu. Iglasty las, gałązki sosny i świerku są mocno odczuwalne w nosie.
Na zapleczu niewielka porcja gorzkiej czekolady. 
Jest tak poprawnie i stylowo, że aż ciężko w to uwierzyć. 
 Smak:  Dokładnie tak powinno smakować wzorowe Black IPA!
Intensywnie nachmielone Czarne Ale z gigantczną porcją ciemnych, palonych słodów. Podparte intensywną dawką iglaków z ociekającą wprost żywicą z ich kory. Ociera się wprost o absurd w swojej kremowości, gładkości na języku.
Akcenty prażonego słonecznika widoczne są jak na dłoni. W drugim rzucie wyczuwalne sugestie gorzkiej czekolady i nieziemski posmak orzechowego cappuccino, który powoduje natychmiastową chęć oblizywania się ze smakiem ;) 
Goryczka chociaż długa i dość intensywana, umiejętnie wpasowuje się w całość.
Pomimo pozornej słodyczy sam profil piwa jest wytrawny, smukły.
Piwo ma sporo ciała, oleistą, gęstą, jedwabistą kołderkę.
Z radością sięgam po kolejne łyki i obserwuje w jakim szybkim tempie to piwo znika z kielicha.
Wyborne Black IPA! Jadno z najlepszych jakie piłem. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie na średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Jeśli ktoś by zapytał mnie o wzorowo skrojone Black IPA, takie które można polecić każdemu jako wyznacznik stylu, z całą pewnością poleciłbym to właśnie piwo.
Jest doskonale zbalansowane z odpowiednią porcją ciemnych słodów, stylowymi akcentami prażonego słonecznika, gorzkiej czekolady, orzechowego cappuccino. Przyprawione dużą dozą żywicy i iglaków z sosnowych lasów.
Kremowa, jedwabista tekstura, półpełne ciało i ogromna pijalność.
Dodatkowym atutem jest niska cena 11,7 PLN.

Pine, chocolate, roasted sunflower seeds, citrus in nose. Pours dark brown with beige head. Taste is medium dry with same flavours as in aroma. Medium bitter grapefruit-like finish. Overall good, drinkable, bit too malty for me.

7.2%ABV. Black IPA.

Tapped out black. 40°SRM.

Nose had some nice fresh citrus and light pine aromas. Malt on the nose.

Mouthfeel is watery soap. Palate has roasted flavors with bitter and the clean burnt wood flavor of good charcoal. Alcohol In the palate. Hops are bitter, herbaceous and bitter melon.

Finish is medium.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark brown pour with a bubbly tan head, aroma has rich chocolate with some dark fruits, taste has chocolate with hints of pine and citrus, bitter finish but mostly chocolate, with light roast.

Bottle. Sensoric. Pitch black witch medium, light brown, densed head. Medicare head retention and perfect lacing. Very nice aroma, dominated by tropical fruits (mango) and citrus notes (orange), in the background some strong, piney character. Light to medium roasted malts aroma, but definitely in the second row. When beer becomes warmer those roasted malts are more intense and noticeable (mainly coffee). Taste is medium bitter, but it quickly disappears and become more malty-semi-sweet. Medium body, creamy and slick texture, finish is semi-bitter, raw, harsh and dry. Summing up what to say, this beer is f.... fantastic. When you close the eyes its IPA, when you open black IPA. First black IPA Ive tasted, which is not so dominated by roasted malts aromas. Great and definitely worth tasting.

Bottle from Saveur Biere. Pours dark brown with slightly off-white head, leaving lacing. Chocolate, roast, liquorice and citrusy hops in the aroma. Slightly grainy. Dry, roasty, piney, bitter taste with dark chocolate and coffee. Smooth finish. Very nice!
Zywica, nieco cytrusow. W smaku wytrawne, ani sladu ciemnych slodow. Zywiczne. Szlachetna goryczka.

Piwo jak niemal jak typowe Imperial IPA, z tą niewielką różnicą, że gdzieś tam, daleko przebija się nieco palony smak i aromat. Ponad to, standard - ładny aromat chmielowy i nieco słodowy. Wyraźna, acz nie przesadzona goryczka z lekką kontrą słodową.

Trwała piana, gęsto zdobi szkło. Aromat żywiczny, sosnowy. W smaku czekoladowe wafelki, troche palonosci przelamane dominującą nutą sosnowego chmielu. Po momentami minimalnie alkoholowej goryczce, wchodzi posmak w stylu gorzkiej czekolady. Dość wysoko nasycone. Smaczna BIPA, z tym, że nic nie urwała.

Geproefd bij de Vinotake tijdens de IPA/Sour tasting. Nu een Black IPA uit Schotland. Uitgeschonken in een Struise BD proefglas. Schenkt bijna gitzwart uit, met een lichtbruine schuimkraag. Mooie aromas van koffie, pure chocolade, met de hop mooi aanwezig in de aromas van pijnboom en tropisch fruit. Het smaakpallet is vol van koffie, gebrande karamel, mokka, met een mooie hop balans van pijnboom en tropische vruchten, zwarte bessen en iets van zoethout. Bitter, maar ook bloemig door de hop. Blijft een interessante stijl, Black IPA. Deze kan zich meten met de landgenoten van Brewdog, een mooi bier.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle @Les Vignerons (Rome). Pours deep brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma of hops and roasted malts, balanced. Flavour is medium roasted malty and hoppy, medium bitterness. Medium body, medium to light carbonation. Ok.
Mid way between a stout and an IPA. Taste roasted malt and hops. Quite good and unusual.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Near perfect balance in the aromas and taste. Some might find it leans a bit to the IPA side but summers nearly here so why not.

A colablack beer, a head is quite small and beige. Aroma has citrusfruits, coffee, roastiness and some tropical notes. Taste has citrusfruits, wood, some coffee. Medium bodied. Balanced beer, I would prefer more fruitness.

Bottle sample at a tasting at troubless place. Thanks Stas. Dark brown with a big beige head. Aroma of roast, licorice, piney hops, some coffee. Roasty flavor, quite dry, with roast, a bit of licorice, a bit of coffee, and bitter piney hops. Medium-bodied. A decent Black IPA.

330ml bottle from Alesela. Pours a black-brown colour with a beige foamy head leaving lacing. Nose of roast malt, chocolate and resiny citric hop. Taste is roasted, bready malty, with chocolate & coffee, dark fruits and hoppy citrus, grapefruit & pine, tangy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry spicy bitter finish. Very drinkable black IPA.

Pas mauvais mais jai trouvé ça un peu trop liquide et pas assez complexe en bouche ... Jaime pas trop par exemple cette acidité franche en fin de bouche ... Mais pour autant, je trouve ça bien fait et plutôt chouette

Bottle 33cl, a dark ale with medium copper head. Nose is on peach, lychee and orange notes. Aroma is on pine, hop resin, licorice, dark coffee, peppery hops, dark chocolate. Quite bitter with long duration at the finish, dry licorice.

Bottle from cgarvieuk. Colour with pretty much black with a thick rich tan head. Aroma citrus, coffee, chocolate, taste mellow light sweetness with a longer chocolate finish and mid bitter. Thick oily texture, with light carbonation. A very nice beer this one.

Bottle from Secrets dAbbaye, Vendin - FR. Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown ivory foam. Smell: intensive grassy hops nose balanced with roasted malt and chocolate notes. Very intensive and fresh. Taste: quiet full body with high grassy hops attack balanced with roasted malt and caramel with chocolate finish. Very tasty and easy drinkable. Good attenuation. Aftertaste: superb bitterness, with pine hint and grassy notes. Roasted finish. One if not my best black IPA !

330ml bottle enjoyed @ home, thanks to BenH! Pours very dark brown with a small but long lasting and bubbly beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, resin, grassy, grapefruit, chocolate and liquorice. Taste is medium to heavy bitter and medium sweet. Medium bodied, slick texture, soft carbonation. Finish is grassy, resinous and slightly roasted.

Bottle from Saveur beer. Pours dark with reddish hue. Grass, pine, citrus, earth, chocolate, wood, chocolate on nose. Chocolate, coffee, toast, citrus with a grapefruit bitter finish. Nice and balanced.

330ml bottle. Jet black colour with average to huge, thick, firm, frothy, mostly lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Minimally sweet-ish, chocolately, dark malty aroma, notes of milk chocolate, dark chocolate, dark berries, a sweaty resinous touch, some pine, a touch of liquorice as well. Taste is bitter hoppy and roasty dark malty, notes of dark chocolate, dark berries, a touch of pine, tropical fruity hints of mango, orange zest, a salty touch of liquorice; full body, creamy texture, smooth palate. Rich and complex, instantly addictive - excellent!
Bottle. Pours a black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty citrus hoppy aroma. roasted malty citrus hoppy bitter flavor. Has a roasted malty citrus hoppy bitter finish.

Black color, off-white head with good retention. Aroma is roasty, hoppy with coffee beans. Flavor has notes of roasted malts, chocolate, some citrus and resins hops.Coffee and roasty final, easy drinkable.

330 ml bottle from Firma Bier, bb 27 Apr 2016.
Almost black body, with a big, stable, creamy, lacing, light brown head.
Amazing aroma with a lot of pine, citrus, grapefruit, dark berries, dark chocolate, caramel, cocoa.
Taste is also delicious and very smooth, with pine, citrus, tropical fruits, berries, cocoa powder, dark chocolate, coffee, subtle liquorice.
Medium, a bit creamy, velvety mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes smooth, a bit warm, bitter, roasty, a bit dry, piney, citric, with cocoa, coffee, some liquorice.

Wow! As much as I like this style, Black IPAs tend to be quite similar in my opinion. But this one really offers a uniqueness and character like very few others and especially the balance is outstanding! Distinctive pine notes, lovely smooth berries and creamy dark malts in perfect harmony. Clearly my favourite BIPA so far!

Bottle at Taps Beer Bar, Changkat, Kuala Lumpur. Poured a clear dark reddish brown with a thin broken off white head. The aroma is red berry fruit, pine needle hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a rich fruity, citrus yeast hop, light alcohol, light yeast palate and a lingering bitter finish. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

(Draught at Craft & Draft, Amsterdam, 20 Feb 2016) Black colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, roasted, hoppy nose with black coffee, black rye bread, pine needles and grapefruit. Malty, roasted taste with notes of dark chocolate, black coffee, pine needles, grapefruit and a generous piney bitterness. More than medium body, quite dry. Solid and well made black IPA. Very nice.

Bottle at the Arcade Tavern, Ipswich. Pours almost black with a tan colour head. Aroma of rich roasted chocolate, coffee, citrus and hop. Light sweetness, medium roasted bitterness. Medium body, texture slick, average carbonation. Lingering chocolate bitterness to finish. Very good.
Bottle 2/12/16 scura buona schiuma piuttosto persistente discreti sentori tostati cioccolato amaro discreto agrumato filo resinoso lieve mirtillo media secchezza buon amaro

Bottle 33cl. Poured into a Teku glass. Opaque dark brown, tall frothy tan head, good retention, good lacing; rich aroma, dark malts, roasted, cocoa, dark fruit, licorice, light citrus, pine; taste medium sweet and bitter, malty, dark chocolate, light coffee, with long duration, malty sweetbitter finish, spicy notes; medium body, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation; very smooth, very tasty, very good.

0,33l bottle at home. BB 27.04.2016. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells of exotic fruits, light grapefruit, light resin, mango, grassy notes, licorice, nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of exotic fruits, mango, light licorice, caramel, light roast, bit herbal, also a bit lactic. finishes lightly roasted with notes of licorice and exotic fruits. good stuff.

330ml bottle from Firma bier. Awesome fresh and hoppy black IPA with some roastiness, licorice, pine and coffee notes. Reminds me of Stone Sublimely Self-righteous which is one of my favorite black IPAs. Great stuff.

On tap at Craft & Draft. Pours a very dark brown, with a very tall head with good retention. Tons of resinous hops in the nose, together with milk chocolate, roasted malts and cocoa. Hop bitter taste, with notes of resin mixed with dark chocolate, ice coffee and a tiny bit of sourness.

0.15 l on tap at Craft & Draft. Almost black with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, brown head. Sweetish-malty, fruity, slightly roasty aroma of mango, passion fruit, dark chocolate, some coffee, hazelnut and blackberry. Sweetish-malty, fruity, slightly roasty taste of dark chocolate, some coffee, hazelnut, mango, passion fruit and blackberries, followed by a short, slightly bitter, roasty and slightly resiny finish. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, flat. Good!

Pours a very deep brown, close to black body with a light-brown, very long-lived head. Sweet, hoppy and strong aroma of tropical fruits, sweat and sweet caramel. I might be exaggerating the sweetness: I had this right after a flemish red... Quite strong flavour of tropical fruits, citrus, resin and pine, with gentler malty elements like roasted malt and caramel in the background. This is definitely on the hoppy side of the BIPA scale! Light sweet and moderate bitter taste. Mid-bodied, dry and smooth on the palate, soft carbonation. A nice BIPA, but maybe not one of the very best Ive had. 
[15 cl sample from tap @ Irreale, Madrid]
Lives up to the deScription. Black with a creamy beige head. Taste starts malty with some bitter chocolate and finished with some grapefruit notes.
Bottle. Black pour. Nice aroma of citrus, roasted malt and passion fruit. Taste of bitter chocolate, citrus, peach, roast and mild licorice. Good stuff.

Botella 33 cl tomada en el momento en el kraken 19..12..2015 lote ITD02 hasta 13..07..2016. color negro con espuma beige. Aromas y sabores tostados maltosos con ligeros amargos herbaceos. Cuerpo medio 7.2 vol que no se dejan notar mucho. Normal.

Flaska från Irreale, Madrid. Klar mörkt brun med ett stort krämigt smutsvitt skum. Dofter av grapefrukt, citrus, tall, choklad och rostad malt. Smakinslag av apelsinskal, grapefrukt, choklad, rostad malt och tall. Avslutas med en lätt lätt sötlakritston. Medel mot stor kropp. Oljig munkänsla. Mycket gott!

33cl [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
Appearance: dark brown with beige head.
Aroma: roasted malt, hops, vague citrus, vague chocolate.
Taste: mild bitter, some citrus, chocolate, a little spicy.
Palate: mild body, medium CO2.
Overall: very nice.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Really dark color with light brown head. Aroma is really fresh and hoppy. Smells like a standard IPA, not a black one. In the taste you get a slight roastiness but only on the finish and aftertaste. Hops are fresh and grassy. Body is soft, balanced out by a crisp carbonation. Really well made and easy to drink.

Bottle at home from Bierdekonig, 21st November 15. Looks elegant, black with a foamy off white head, aroma is piney hops, slight liquorice, some spice. Taste is complex bitter pine, citrus hops, malty chocolate, spicy, lingering bitterness. Really well built BIPA from Tempest, which I have rated highly for years.
Dark color, brown notes and tan head. Aroma and taste have mango, pine, citrus, resin and grapefruit, mixed with coffee and chocolate. Really nice BIPA, more on the hoppy side.

Dark brown color, almost black with medium tan head. Aromas is dank, with sweet citrus fruits, tropical fruits, but also caramel ans toasty notes. Medium body. Taste follows the aroma, very hoppy, with grapefruit, citrus fruits, dark chocolate, pine, resin and coffee traces. Slightly bitter aftertaste.
Appearance: Black as the night with tan head. Aroma: True Black IPA, coffee, chocolate, pine, resin and tropical fruits. Taste: Aromawise, more IPA than Black. Aftertaste: Slightly bitter. Lovely!

330ml bought @ the brewery for under 3 quid and poured into a pint glass. Pours black as a crow on a cloudy night with a finger of dark tan head that lasts. 
Smells like youd think with that beauty burnt coffee and dark chocolate smell but with a bit of resiny hop peeking through as well.
 Tastes like a pretty near perfect version (for my taste) of a black IPA. Lots of coffee, a wee bit of choc to keep it from the too dry side and, rare indeed, the perfect amount of sticky/piney hop to hold its own handily against all that darkness. Perfect balance between burnt/sweet/bitter.
 Not over heavy on the palate for such a flavourful beer. Could easily go another one (or more if Id not only bought 2).
 Totally worth the hype. Had a few black IPA in my day and really only saw them as a change of pace but this one is gonna go in my regular rotation.
33cl bottle from cervezalandia. Dark color with thin beige head. Medium bitterness, low sweetness. Body is round and smooth. Flavour is light cacao, light fruit, light coffee. Quite balanced.

From trade with Douberd, many thanks! 33cl bottle. Pours pitch black with a medium good lasting tan head. Aroma of coffee, burned malt, very hoppy, spruce. Taste is very hoppy, spruce, vanilla, toffee, coffee in the aftertaste, very delicious!

Bottle at home. Pours an almost black dark brown with a tan head. Roasted malts and citrus aromas. A lovely balance between the dark malts and citrus piney hoppiness. A truly great Black IPA. Whats more, the IPA aspect isnt tainted by the dark elements, as is the case in so many Ive tried. Ace

Bottle. Pours deep clear reddish black, medium tan head, creamy with nice lacing. Aroma is roasty, hint of ashtray, pine, light grapefruit and a bit of dust. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, roasty, pine, hints of citrus. Medium body, very well balanced.

(Tempest In The Dark We Live) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a teku, ABV 7.2%
Black coloured body, tall, thick and creamy, dark beige head, with wxcellent retention.
Aroma has citrus, grapefruit, chocolate,light roasted malts, mocha.
Taste of citrus, hops, grapefruit, ash, roasted malts, chocolate, nicely bitter, mocha.
Medium body, good carbonation, smooth on the palate.
Very good!

Bottle from Slijterij van Pernis. Black coloured with a small sized tan head. Nose is roasted malts, coffee, coffee cream, citrus, a bit floral. Flavour is roasted malts, coffee, coffee cream and chocolate. Very creamy, great mouthfeeling. Really good stuff.

0,33l fles gedeeld met bryanvdv. Zwart met een bruine kraag. Geur gemiddeld hoppig met wat donker fruit maar ook biscuit en cacao. Smaak bitter en zoet vol iets geroosterd maar ook likeur. In de afdronk drop en koffie. Body is mooi vol.

33cl Bottle. Appearance: deep dark brown color with a small beige head.
Aroma:Orange peel and roast 
Taste Suprisingly a malty sweetness ufront , caramel and roasted malts.. Some licorice and chocolte tones, mint (?), a bit of grapefruit and orange zest in the finish. Dark tones a bit to dominant, if you said its a bit hoppy portter I would have believed it as well.
medium body, below average carbonation.

Nicely done. Subtle and well balanced, which is a tough achievement with a BIPA. Pours black with good mocha head. Tico consistency. Roast and dark chocolate with poignant touch of citrus. Tap at Churchkey.

Negro opaco y espuma beis compacta. Aromas intensos de fruta naranja, pino y tostados. Cuerpo medio - alto, sabor inicial de fruta naranja pronto sobrepasado por un intenso sabor de pino que acaba con un amargor tostado y resinoso.
Pours black with a large tan head. Aroma is earthy, dark fruits and slight dust. Taste is earthy, toffee and pine. Decent beer.
Poured deep dark brown with a frothy beige head. Aroma of sweet citrus and soft malt. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, moderately bitter, loads of roast malt.

Bottle. Deep dark brown color. Orange peel and roast in the aroma. Malty sweet, firm roasty flavor with licorice, peppermint, grapefruit and orange peel/ I have trouble really getting into these roasty black IPAs, but this no doubt is a good beer.

Bottle, pours dark brown/black with a tan head. Aroma: pine, citrus, sweat
Taste: Chocolate, pine, citrus, espresso, herbs, orange, grass. Light-medium sweet, medium bitter, oily to creamy texture, medium body, average carbonation, lingering orange and chocolate bitter finish. Lovely balance.

Bottle from Berts Bierhuis Biltstraat, batch ITD01 BB 27 Apr 2016, large sample. Dark color, medium frothy brown head. Aroma of slight roast, piney hops, bit grassy, citrus, grapefruit, bit cedar wood like. Slight sweet in taste, orange, touch of dry wood, medium bitterness, slight chocolate. Bit dry in the finish. Very interesting stuff. Good.

Aroma: floral hops, some pine, dark, toasted malts. Appearance: black, small, creamy, beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: first intense floral hops, toasted malts, some fruitiness. Overall: very nice Black IPA, well-balanced, good aroma. Pint at Cloisters Bar, Edinburgh.
Bottle. Black with a lovely hoppy aroma. Pleasant hoppy flavour and a small head. So drinkable it is unbelievable. An excellent example of this style.
Schenkt een mooi zwart bier. Geuren van hop, zwarte bessen, smaken van hop, zwarte bessen, citrus. De afdronk is bitter met een grassige ondertoon. Een heerlijke Black IPA.

Bottle from Corks of Cotham, Bristol. Jet black and opaque, with a tight, beige, head. Rich aroma of ripe blackberries, pine, plain chocolate and orange peel. Flavour had more chocolate, toasty malts, some black currant fruit pastille sweetness, followed by some pine and a dryish finish. Excellent.
Bottle at home. Toasted malt, blackberry, bitter chocolate, citrus and pine. Porter by appearance. IPA by attitude. Top notch.

Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Pours almost black with a good tan head. Big sweet grapefruit and pine aroma. The taste is full with lots of resinous pine and sweeter tropical notes. The roasted malt flavour is a little in the background. Some coffee and burnt toast. Very tasty.
330ml bottle, pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, citrus, pine. Body is light medium, texture is creamy, finish is moderate bitter and roasty. Carbonation is soft.

Bottle. (£2.39) This is excellent. Beautiful aroma. Smells and tastes alive! Huge flavour, long finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black IPA. 330ml, brown bottle, cork and cask, Edinburgh. Scent is strong grapefruit zest and lightly bitter. Pours black with a thin brown head like a cola. Taste is earthy, full-bodied, and malty. Fantastic.

Bought in Rehills in Newcastle. Pours black with beige head. Looks great. The intensive aroma and taste that of pine and hops with a bit of resin. Medium Bitterness which lingers for a while. One of my favourite black IPAs. Very drinkable too. Recommend it.

Pours a deep black with a large and thick mocha-brown head. Aroma is fruity, roasty, coffee and chocolate sweet. Taste is hop resin, slight caramel, slight malt sweetness, earthy, cocoa and slight coffee. Medium-full bodied with a slightly oily mouthfeel. BB May 2015 so this bottle has been around for a while but the taste has not deteriorated much when compared to other, fresher Black IPAs.

27.12.2014. Aroma of burnt malts, strong piney hops, pine needles. Taste is quite strong and intense with dark malts and again strong pine notes, both in taste and hops. Very tast BIPA but heavy so small amount is preferred.

Bottle from European local swap kindly donated by BenH, many thanks. Very dark brown color with huge beige head. Strong citrus hoppy aroma with nutty notes. Strong citrus hoppy taste with grapefruit, pines, resin. Solid dark malty backbone with coffee notes. Long hoppy bitter finish with light roasty notes. Alcohol is dangerously hidden. Tasty, well balanced beer.
Bottle. This comes flying out the blocks with a huge pine hop aroma. Flavour continues with the pine hope theme with a mild roast coming from the dark malt. Leans more to the IPA end of the spectrum.

On tap @ brewdog, Edinburgh. Body is nearly black, head is medium, brownish, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is pine, aroma is roasted malt, mild coffee, dark chocolate, light licorice, pine resins, dried fruits. Medium sweet, medium to heavy roasty and hoppy bitter. Medium to full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Easy dessert beer, very good one.

On tap @ BierCab. Its what youd call a black one this. A huge brownish head safely on top. Lacing as heck and really lasting also. It smells really lovely. Hoppy and dark roasted, lots of salty licorice and shoey leather. Superb aroma. Oh, it tastes much the same. Lots and lots of licorice and leather in the taste. My dictionary suggested leather jacket, and I actually dont disagree on that one. Really full-bodied with a average carbonation level. Lovely burp. Fresh hoppy, kinda herbal spicy roasted. That lovely licorice just seduces me. Love it. 08.08.2014
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is roast chocolate, pine, taste is similar, dry.

Medium to good dense head, dark whipped cream-like over deep red-brown beer, looking jet-black. Impressive, deeply C-hopped nose but with lots of maltbacking. Dry hopbales, straw. Roasted-hoppy; bitter. Burnt wood, but also a marked, near-salty, mineral flavour. As if trassie were added - lots of DMS? Warming up, gets a bit sweet, rosewater from the hops. Medium bodied, not more, well-carbonated. Reasonable, but not really demarcating Imperial (?) Black (??) IPA... (Please STOP inventing silly style names!!)
Bottle @ RBBSG III. Pours dark brown, beige head. Aroma is pineapple, citrus, caramel. Taste is bitter, malty, more pineapple to end pretty bitter. One of my favorite styles.
Bottle courtesy of JefVerstraete, thank you sir! Dark brown color. Aroma of pine and roast. Taste is nicely balanced bitter pine and roast.

5/VII/14 - 50cl bottle @ RBBSG III (Gent) - BB: 23/XI/14 (2014-729) Thanks to JefVerstraete for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown beer, irregular beige head, unstable, bit adhesive. aroma: very fruity, bit sugary, exotic fruits, piny and resinous, malty, caramel. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bitter start, exotic fruits, some caramel, sweet malts, bit resinous, some honey. Aftertaste: pretty bitter, resinous and piny, citrus, some exotic fruits, little roasted, dairy touch.

Very black with a tan bubbly. Licorice, fresh hops, toasty, dark malts, but not chocolatey. Refreshing yet full bodied. Lots of black IPA goodness. Lots to like. For my taste not quite thick enough, not chocolate malty enough. But thats just my preference. But lovely developed and so nice to drink a black IPA here in Barcelona. (On tap at BierCab)

Tap @ BierCAB, Barcelona.
Pours pitch black color with a huge beige head. Very roasty malty aroma, some resinous hops and citric fruits. Roasted malt on the flavor, citric fruits, licorice and faint cocoa, some resinous hops. Nice balance, a very solid CDA. 
4515

10th July 2014Forgetfu Tasting at ChrisOs. Deep amber beer with a very light haze. Big fluffy pale tan head. Palate is airy and light. Mild dark malts, airy with a touch of very light cream. Decent piney hops morphing in to mild tropical fruits, Little citric bitterness. Light semi dry finish. Comes together well, very drinkable.

Bottle shared at the Kvass House, thanks to Bro Kenneth, 10/07/14.
Black with a good sized tan head that dissipates but retains.
Nose is light roast, pine resin, bitter grapefruit fumes, Ribena berries, earthy hops, liqourice.
Taste comprises earthy hops, a trace of booze introduces itself, spice, liqourice, pine cloak, Beeny berries, bitter citric rinse, hint of minerals.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a dose of hop bitterness.
Decent CDA.
Over to you Jan ........ !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Keg at Brewdog Shepherds Bush, London. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Roasty, malty, pine aroma. Tastes similar, roasty, malty, pine, a little grapefruit and some chocolate. A beautifully complex Black IPA. I really enjoy Tempest.

Keg at Brewdog Shepards bush. Opaque black pour with a lasting light tan head. Aroma is earthy liquorice, chic, berry and pine hip. Flavour is semi sweet nutty malt, resin and choc. Good integration of malt and hop. Palate is medium body, nicely rounded. Lingering wood liquorice and berry.

Keg at Brewdog. Black, big foamy tan head lasts a minute or so. Aroma of pine and lime. Body is medium, touch of spritz, slightly foamy. Taste is soft lemon, chocolatey, semisweet, pot pourri in the finish. Not really bitter but its a little drying. Incredibly drinkable and very smooth.

Bottle. Dark brown with a beige head. Aromas are smoky with toffee and nutty coffee bean. Cream with chocolate malt drink and light pine. Earthy with yeast and hints of lemon. Flavours are earthy coffee with blackberries and green, leafy pine. Spiced oranges with creamy oak barrel. A little funky, in a good way, with dark chocolate and low grapefruit bitterness. Green on the finish. Warming alcohol. Good.

Bottle at RBSG 2014. Thx to everyone for sharing todays bottles!
APPEARANCE:black beer, small unstable beige head. UFOs
NOSE: vanilla, chocolate, hoppy.
TASTE: very hoppy, nothing black in the taste actually...
Pours brown with orange highlights and a tan head. The smell is pine and citrus. The taste is pine, citrus, roasted malt, caramel ending dry. Light/medium with fine elegant carbonation.

Bottle @ RBBSG, 2014. Bottle from Deliciouslydifferent. Dark brown, beige foam. Medium carbonation. Aroma of light roasted malts with lots of grapefruit and bitter hops. Very well balanced. Very nice example of the style.

Bouteille 50cl @ RBBSG III, courtesy of Jef, yet another awesome beer, thanks! BB 23/11/2014
Brune foncée, col fin beige.
Arôme offre un régal olfactif au niveau de pin et houblon (Chinook / Simcoe?), le tout accompagné par un super malté grillé qui arrive plus en retrait tout comme les effluves de chocolat.
Palais est profond au niveau malté, grillé et caramel, le tout assez anglais dans lapproche mais efficace. Le tout est accompagné par un super fini houblonné, principalement sur des pointes de pin. Petite touche de chocolat poudreux arrive en fin de bouche pour lier le tout.
Simple, mais super bien brassée.

500 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBSG III. Thanks to JefVerstraete! Blackish solid thick mocha head. Sweet roast & grounds in the nose, nice hops, some ashes. Taste is ashes, grounds upfront, very bitter, very roasted, some sweeter chocolate, lingering bitterness. Touch grainy body. Not bad at all.

Sampled @ RBBSG III. Dark brown color, medium sized light brown head that lasts for quite a while and leaves good lacing. Aroma is malts, lightly roasty, lots of hops. Taste malts, lightly roasty, again lots of hops, a bit fruity, decently bitter. Medium body, medium carbonation.
On tap at Biercab. Black colour with off-white head. Fruity, grape, citric, jucie aroma. Malt, roasted, jucie, sweet, grape taste. Medium body.

Keg at The Hanging Bat. Pours darkest Black with a short lived Tan head. Roasty aroma with a wack of Pine. The flavour has some pretty pronounced coffee and chocolate which to me feel at odds with the lemon pine wood cleaner hop vibe. Its interesting and has a pronounced hoppiness. Tasty enough but I personally couldnt drink too much of it

Bottle from The Hanging Bat, Edinburgh. BB 23/11/14. Pours verity dark brown/black with a slight brownish red edge and a tan head. Aroma is grassy, woody, a light maltiness. Medium body, medium carbonation. Some chocolatey treacle, grass, light herbs, lemon, grapefruit, earthy... Good balance, really pretty tasty.

Draught at The Hanging Bat, Edinburgh on 17 May. Poured black, with a dense beige head. Aroma of citrus hops, toasted malt and burnt sugar. Pine needles and bitter grass in the flavour, with some roasted malt and molasses. Finish was very nice lingering hop bitterness, mixed with burnt malt and dark fruits.

Bottle from Beer Central, Sheffield. Clear, very dark, reddy brown. Thin, tight, lasting, tan coloured head. Blackcurrant. Liquorice. Coffee grinds. Light, peachy grapefruit. Taste is thick, blackcurrant, sweetness. Thats soon boshed out of the way, by a pine resin, pithy bitterness. Creamy palate. Some oiliness. Carbonation is light, and suits the beer beautifully. Finish has a treacly sweetness, with a rising, lasting, pithy, bitterness. Utterly delicious.
Classy piwo shared with McTapps. Deep in soul and body with balanced aromas. Hops with some berries, bit coffee and some bitter roasted malt. To recommend.

Bottle from BenH - many thanks! The beer pours out in a deep black colour with steady low head and medium body. Aroma of fresh hops, citrus and nuts - very nice! Taste of fresh aromatic hops, very light malt, citrus, nuts, straw and spruce. HInts of dark grains and herbs. This Black IPA was so smooth and delicious to drink that I was almost angry when my glass got emptier and emptier. Really great and highly enjoyable beer - quaffable, delicious, smooth drinkable. I loved it.

Bottle from Cornelius. Pours black with small creamy tan head. Coffee caramel in the nose. Light hops. Taste has vegetable under notes which I didnât get from last few bottles. Medium body, hides alcohol well. Good but best drunk fresher than this one. EDIT- the second half of this bottle had warmed a little a really opened up. Loads more flavour and hops come through. Really good.

Bottle 500ml. @ home.[ Trade by cgarvieuk ]. Clear dark brown colour with a large, frothy - creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, moderate to heavy hoppy, pine, citrus, grapefruit. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, roasted, coffee notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20131006]

Norwich Tap House. Black - funnily enough. Thin head. Nice full malts with sweet dates and cake. Tempered fresh hops give it a nice bitter bite without going over the top. Just a hint of chocolate in there as well. Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle at home from alesela dark ruby brown, rich Seville orange and chocolate. Full bodied, piney herbal hops. Low bitterness, medium carbonation chocolate, marmite, orange peel. Coffee notes in finish.

Pours black with a thin-ish tan head. Slightly lemony on the nose with a general citrus fruit smell. Tastes of chocolate and oranges with raisin and biscuit finish. Very nice, could go back again and will buy more.
Bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. This black beer pours with a quickly disappearing tan head. It has chocolate and tropical fruit flavours with zesty citrus and pine on the finish. Excellent!

500ml bottle during a prolonged stay at Brauhaus. Lasting, bubbly, tan-coloured head. Pitch black. Grass and dark fruits to the nose on a roasted malty backbone. Well blended flavours of dark grapefruit and dark malts. Lingering bittersweet tail. Full bodied. Delicious late night sipper (Edinburgh 06.08.2013).
Looks and smells delicious! Hops are spot on. Slightly chewy. Nice lacing and legs. BOSH!!

Bottle from Beer Hive, Edinburgh [070813] 
Black, ruby edges, frothy big tan head
Aroma of strong piney hops, greassy hop, roasted malts, touch floral, hoppy for a BIPA
Taste of piney, grassy hops, very hoppy, quite bitter roasted malts, dark malts, touch of espresso, slight hint of chocolate, quite complex flavour
Palate - Medium carb and body, smooth, quite bitter hop palate tempered a little by the malts. Finish as main flavour, bitter roast, bitter piney hop, nice lingering bitterness
Overall - Very good BIPA, hoppy piny front with a good dark roast background thats not overly roasted. However, it is missing those dark chocolate malt flavours which I like in a BIPA so its just below a 4.
500ml bottle courtesy of JohnRMurdoch - very dark brown near black, good creamy tan head, pine and grapefruit aroma, initial sweetness followed by a big green hop kick, prolonged hoppy aftertaste
500ml bottle from Hippo Beers. Almost black, reasonable head. Tar pine hop aroma. Roasted fruity hop flavour. Hoppy aftertaste. A solid black IPA.
Bottle from valhallas goat Glasgow a near Black beer with a bubbly tan head some roasted malt and light chocolate but deep fruity flavour with a light bitter finish
Lasting creamy head tops pure black beer. Aroma has vanilla and spicy notes but only a hint of roastiness and not much obvious hop. Flavour increases roast and firm bitterness

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2017 Bottle from Cornelius. Black body with a thick tan head. Excellent lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, cocoa powder, orange, chocolate and pine. Flavour of peanut shell, chocolate, blackcurrant, freshly rubbed hops and pine. Sharp, lingering bitterness. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft carbonation. A fruity, flavoursome Black IPA. Superb.

Full rocky easy dark tan head. Opaque black with an translucent orange thin line at the bottom of the glass. Excellent balance. Not too linear either unlike other beers of the style. Some complexity and earthy wrapped in a line of juicy sap.

Bottle shared at home. Pours jet black with a thick tan head, which doesnt last. Citrus and pine on the nose, faint black malts. Taste has more of the same. Finish is bitter and good. Interesting, but not typical black IPA.

Bottle from Valhallas Goat, Glasgow. It pours near black with a large light tan head. The nose is roasted malt, coffee, roasty, pine, candy, juicy orange, tangerine, plum and date. The taste is roasted malt, coffee, toast, earth, light spice, plum, date, orange, grapefruit, treacle, nice bitterness, pine and varnish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Flavoursome, good depth and very well-balanced indeed. Pretty damn tasty,

Bottle at Bruces - London. Huge thanks to Paul for this Scottish gem. Pours deep brown with a large, frothy beige head. The aroma holds some juicy citrus, wet pine, subtle toast. Medium sweet flavor with tons of juicy orange and grapefruit, subtle roast, a bit of sticky pine, dirt. Medium bodied with fine, creamy carbonation. Moderate resinous finish, toasty pine, chocolate, soft roast, grapefruit, orange, tangerine, dirt. Lovely stuff. Exceptional balance.

50cl bottle. Pours opaque black with a generous creamy head. The nose has a green note maybe going into lime - no chocolate to speak of. The taste has burnt oranges and some spice. The palate is well balanced - medium to full bodied with a tangy texture and a long clean finish. Overall, a really well made beer though Id expect more chocolate on a black IPA.

500ml bottle from The Beerhive. 
Large tan head, good lacing. Body is almost dark. Nose mainly coffee and chocolate, citrus comes through more as the beer warms. Flavour is tropical fruit and mocha battling it out, finish is bitter chocolate. Rich, creamy mouthfeel. Another big winner from Tempest.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2014 bottle Coppers Ncl. Hops pine and chocolate perfectly combined. Creamy bitter palate with a lovely long dry finish. The pine and spruce lingers long in the aftertaste. Really excellent. *Rerate, 10/10/14. Bottle with a BBE 02.04.14. Even richer and more vineous,  loads of body, the hop hot is still as fresh. Truly stunning.

Bottle. As good as black with decent tan head. Very noce aroma, lots of pine and citrus hops with little coffee. Taste is more coffee up front with pine and citrus in the background. Medium body with a bitter finish. Very nice

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2016 Cask at the 9a ... deep black ... thin tan head ... soft chocolate roast ... melow soft malt nose ... rich chocolate ... dark malts ... Full rounded body ... rich complex smooth chocolate. .. 4.0

Keg at cloisters... Dark black thin tan lacing.. Soft rich woody chocolate roast malts nose... Dark roast.. Light bitter chocolate... Lught pine... Little too fizzy... Thin body 3.7

Darkest brown body, initially decent tan head dissipates to a ringed but lasting hoop and consistent bubbly film. I dont know if its the ABV or freshness, but I got little else but cellophane/parcel packaging with a touch of cheap coffee cream when it warmed up. 
Initial taste of weak brewed Ooolong, a small tang but a very smooth carb and slight bitterness is a wee bit disjointed - weirdly refreshing but a touch watery. Nae hops. No big palate impact for an imperial. Midway through is like a chocolate mousse, really creamy and devilishly moreish but lacking in any sweetness. Skitty bitterness on the finish, where this really salvages itself. Pacey coffee, chewy hops peek through and a wrap around of Sparking pepper linger as the CO2 holds firm.After an inauspicious start, this proved supremely drinkable. The hops are buried in a dark malt swell and took a while to work towards. Silky smooth underlayer of carbonation gives a righteous creamy mouthfeel. Theres plenty to enjoy but I wish was more frontloaded - I look forward to the other bottle in 6 months time.
Bottle, The Beer Hive, Edinburgh
